column4: how can i see information about users and groups on a machine in console mode?
and also change a user from a group to another
you want to see what groups are set on your machine or what groups your user is a member of ?
to see what groups are set up on the machine look in /etc/group that will list them
if you want to see what groups your user belongs to type groups
and to add a new group?
best to have a quick read through man group / man groups / man groupadd
so i did a cat /etc/group and apart from my username and root there a a lot of users like xfs and rpc , what are these and why?
they are used by system software don't need to worry about them
so do you know a good howto about users , groups and stuff like that? you know , to understand things a little better
for system admin guides and howto's have a look at www.tldp.org
The Linux System Administrators' Guide would be a good place to start
